articles.description: On the Fourth of July, the city of Roseburg came alive with the sights and sounds of the patriotic holiday: crackling fireworks, the boom of mortars, families cheering and laughing at the pyrotechnics.
articles.title: Fireworks blaze across Roseburg over the Fourth of July weekend

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Effective July 14, 2025, IFPL will rise to Level 3 in Douglas County. Restrictions apply to industrial operations on public and private forestlands, including limited hours for power-driven machinery. Details at www.dfpa.net or www.blm.gov/orwafire.
articles.title: Douglas Forest Protective Association Elevates Industrial Fire Precaution Level to 3

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: July 11, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Former Douglas County corrections deputy Jeremiah Heredia faces assault and misconduct charges after allegedly striking an inmate in an isolation cell. The inmate, who reportedly flicked toilet water at Heredia, is also charged with aggravated harassment.
articles.title: Former Douglas County Jail Deputy, Inmate Both Face Charges After Isolation Cell Incident

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Phoenix Charter School’s sponsorship by Roseburg Public Schools has ended, halting its high school program for now. But Phoenix School will continue to provide youth services and support, vowing to help students and families as they navigate their next steps.
articles.title: Phoenix School Faces Setback, But Support for Students Remains Strong

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: July 10, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Former Douglas County sheriff’s deputy Jeremiah Heredia has been released from jail without charges filed, following his arrest for alleged misconduct. The DA now has up to 30 days to decide whether to proceed, as a related jail harassment case may be influencing the timeline.
articles.title: Court Takes No Action as Charges Remain Pending for Former Deputy

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Former Douglas County sheriff’s deputy Jeremiah Heredia has been released from jail without charges filed, following his arrest for alleged misconduct. The DA now has up to 30 days to decide whether to proceed, as a related jail harassment case may be influencing the timeline.
articles.title: Former Deputy Walks Free as Prosecutors Hold Off on Charges

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: July 9, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: ODOT began significant layoffs Monday, cutting 483 jobs due to a failed legislative funding package. Portland transportation also faces layoffs, prompting urgent calls for solutions amid declining revenues.
articles.title: Oregon Transportation Crisis Deepens with Massive ODOT Layoffs
